page.title: 10CHILDRENS GAMES IN ABINGDON
page.content: Your opponent lays their marble or marbles on the ground,then you lay your marble on yhe ground.The person whose marble is nearest to the pot,which is usually a rough hole in the ground,goes first.Then you hit the marble with the side of your first finger,aiming for the pot.If you get your marble in the pot first you then try to hit your opponents marble in to the pot.The first person to do this is the winner and they win their opponents marble. Written by Carl Drew aged 11 years SKIPPING Skip,skip as I play skipping in the playground.Here is one of the rhymes we sing."Mother in the kitchen,doing a bit of stitching,in comes the Bogey man and out she ran." We also play Blocky which is a chasing game. Written by Marie Thomas aged 10 years.
